title: NYC cafe opening for artificial intelligence chatbot dates
description: While major dating apps like Bumble and Tinder have embraced AI, spending millions on tools that aim to enhance their efficiency and the user experience still others are betting the future will involve AI companions.
content:
Major dating apps like Bumble and Tinder have embraced AI, spending millions on tools that aim to enhance their efficiency and the user experience.
But, one new company — the London-based Eva AI — is taking it a step further. They’re betting solely o... [2552 chars]

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang brings AI cred to CES
description: CES is no longer a spectacle of gimmicky technology. This year, it's about how artificial intelligence is already driving the next industrial revolution, at least if Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote speech is any indication.
content:
In past years, CES in Las Vegas has highlighted such groundbreaking technologies as electric salt spoons and Tasers that double as MP3 players.
But, increasingly, the annual event is moving beyond gimmicky inventions to be a major player in the world... [2847 chars]

title: Canada has been silent on one of the most frightening stories of our time
description: Artificial intelligence has the potential to do far more harm than we are currently acknowledging as a country
content:
The dire warnings about AI keep coming.
Eric Schmidt, former chief executive of Google, says that within a few years, millions of independent AI agents working together “will develop their own language.” And “we won’t understand what they’re doing.” ... [4363 chars]

title: AI in 2026: How it will help and hurt everyday life
description: Many are worried that Artificial Intelligence (AI) will lead to hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of jobs disappearing permanently in 2026. However, experts say worrying about what AI might bring is counterproductive and that people should focus on how they can become the best versions of themselves
content:
The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) by the public grew by leaps and bounds in 2025.
What was once seen as experimental or niche has quickly become mainstream. Already, millions of people are using AI to write work emails, put together charts and ... [5487 chars]

title: RBI flags global uncertainties, says Indian Economy well-placed to withstand shocks
description: NEW DELHI, Jan 1: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said India’s economy and financial system remain resilient despite heightened global uncertainties, elevated asset valuations, and rising geopolitical risks, according to the Financial Stability Report (FSR), December 2025. The report noted that global growth has shown greater resilience than anticipated, supported by fiscal measures, front-loaded trade, and strong investment in artificial intelligence (AI). However, it cautioned that risks to global financial stability remain elevated due to high public debt, stretched […]

title: 8 Major Retailers Experimenting With AI, From Walmart to Sephora
description: Walmart, Target, and Home Depot are using artificial intelligence to offer shoppers personalized assistants and faster checkout experiences.
content:
Walmart introduced the world to its AI shopping assistant, Sparky, in June. Shoppers can use the chatbot in the Walmart app to find products, read reviews, and receive personalized purchase recommendations.

title: Electing right governor, AG tops SC’s to-do list for 2026
description: South Carolina, Charleston priorities include managing federal cuts dealing with artificial intelligence, protecting judicial independence, managing growth.

title: Even the Sky May Not Be the Limit for A.I. Data Centers
description: Some tech leaders are concerned that the artificial intelligence race will exhaust available land and energy. The solution might lie in orbit.
content:
If the architects of the artificial intelligence boom are right, it is only a matter of time before data centers — the giant computing facilities that power A.I. — will float in orbit and be visible in the night sky like planets.
